titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the James McLaren Breed Dwight Papers
titlestmt.author: compiled by Marguerite S. Witkop

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday January 10, 2019 at 10:31

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: Five manuscript volumes in the handwriting of various persons, one of whom was James McLaren Breed Dwight. Included are 3 volumes of Edwards Amasa Park's lectures on theology, 1 volume of William G. T. Shedd's lectures on church history and 1 volume on Woolsey and Hillhouse family genealogy.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: James McLaren Breed Dwight Papers (MS 836). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: James McLaren Breed Dwight: graduated from Yale College in 1846; studied theology in Andover, Mass., 1854-1855 and in New Haven, 1856-1859; studied law at Columbia College Law School, and graduated and was admitted to the New York Bar in 1861.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Five manuscript volumes in the handwriting of various persons, one of whom was James McLaren Breed Dwight. Included are 3 volumes of Edwards Amasa Park's lectures on theology, 1 volume of William G. T. Shedd's lectures on church history and 1 volume on Woolsey and Hillhouse family genealogy.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Unpublished materials authored or otherwise produced by the creator(s) of this collection are in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

controlaccess.persname: Shedd, William G. T. (William Greenough Thayer), 1820-1894
